docs.lead_paragraph: THE world's most prominent society of oenophiles, La Confrerie des Chevaliers du Tastevin, a group whose chief purposes are to drink well, eat well and spare no expense doing so, is experiencing the ravages of inflation. The impact is not so severe as to cause irreparable harm, but it was clearly evident at Monday night's opulent annual induction feast at the Pierre Hotel. Beneath the elegant atmosphere furnished by fur coats hanging row upon row in the cloakroom, the long silk and satin gowns of the women, the white ties and tails of the men, the crimson and gold ribbons supporting the symbolic silver cups called tastevins, the seven-course meal with six wines, ran an undercurrent of discontent. It was not sufficient to threaten the gala atmosphere, but it was there, almost palpable, sounding an intrusive note.

headline.main: TASTEVIN GALA FEELS THE EFFECT OF INFLATION
